{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.05926v1", "title": "The Interconnection Tensor Rank and the Neural Network Storage Capacity", "summary": "Neural network properties are considered in the case of the interconnection
tensor rank being higher than two. This sort of interconnection tensor occurs
in realization of crossbar-based neural networks. It is intrinsic for a
crossbar design to suffer from parasitic currents. It is shown that the
interconnection tensor of a certain form makes the neural network much more
efficient: the storage capacity and basin of attraction of the network increase
considerably. A network like the Hopfield one is used in the study.", "main_category": "cond-mat.dis-nn", "categories": "cond-mat.dis-nn,94-10,I.5.1", "published": "2025-04-08T11:32:19Z"}
